page.title: 02LIFE STYLE COUNTRYSIDE 1935
page.content: Fifty years ago food in shops was very different than it is now.There was no frozen food and no foreign takeaways.Many people in the country grew and reared their own produce. Country schools were very small.Often only one room with a screen down the middle.They had children from 5 to 14 years old.Girls wore velvet tunics and hats and boys wore short trousers, blazers and caps.They all wore black lace up boots.In homes and schools they did not usually have central heating.The usual form of heating was an open fire or a coke stove. If you wanted water you had to fetch it from a pump.They used to heat water in kettles. Some toilets would flush but you had to do this with a bucket of water.
